p: Seventeen years of climate treatments resulted in divergent soil fungal and bacterial communities at the whole‐plot level (PerMANOVA F 3,19 = 1.00, p = .028 and F 3,19 = 1.47, p = .01 for fungi and bacteria, respectively). We identified a total of 230 fungal and 112 bacterial taxa across all microsites; the dominant taxa (22 fungal and 19 bacterial taxa) were present in all treatments at similar relative abundances (Fig. S1), but we observed pronounced differences in subordinate taxa (fungi: F 3,19 = 1.20, p = .003; bacteria: F 3,19 = 1.53, p = .008; Figures 1c,d, S2, and S3).
